newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian Oppn calls for further rate cut.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian Oppn calls for further rate cut.

text.p: Australian Opposition treasury spokesman Gareth Evans said on Thursday that capital expenditure and wages figures released earlier pointed to the need for a further interest rate cut.
"Until now, very strong investment growth and concerns about future wages have been the only plausible barriers to further interest rate cuts," Evans said in a statement.
"Today's new figures have removed these barriers," he said.

Official statistics released on Thursday showed that private new capital expenditure fell 2.4 percent, seasonally-adjusted, in the December quarter to an estimated A$10.27 billion from A$10.52 billion in the previous quarter.

Private sector average weekly ordinary time earnings (AWOTE) rose 0.8 percent in the three months to November for a rise of 2.8 percent on the year, while public sector earnings rose 2.2 percent in the quarter, to be up 7.6 percent over the previous 12 months.
The Reserve Bank has cut rates a total 1.5 percentage points since July, 1996.
Its official overnight cash rate now stands at 6.0 percent.
